subject: Re: [junit] JUnit extension
msgSnippet: Hi! It does not solve the problem at all - u still need to change code and recompile it. You don t need to modify anytning now. Just make properties file and
messageBody:
Hi!
It does not solve the problem at all - u still need to change code and recompile it.
You don't need to modify anytning now.
Just make properties file and put there property:
/JUnitProps.config file:
 
# This property contains list of methods to be tested.
#'all' means that u gonna test all method without params that starts with 'test'. Make it default.
unit.<FQPackageName>.<test case name>.testList = all
 
And just read this property before you run that test case. If the value is 'all'(or it's absent for some reason) - run all the test cases. If value is a list of method names - make the loop and add them to your testSuite.
 
Maxim.
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Kevin Bourrillion
To: 'junit@egroups.com'
Sent: Friday, January 19, 2001 11:02 AM
Subject: RE: [junit] JUnit extension

That doesn't satisfy Richard's goal of no recompilation.  I like his idea.  I think I'll try it out on my own test runner.
 
Kevin
 
-----Original Message-----
From: Johannes Link [mailto:john.link@...]
Sent: Friday, January 19, 2001 3:45 AM
To: junit@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] JUnit extension


> 3. Run a specific test in a single test-case.
> Solution: Currently I have to modify a suite() method.
Try:
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(new MyTestCase("testMethod"));

Johannes
